intro: Audouinia capitata, commonly known as the Cape snowbush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are small, leathery, and evergreen, providing a contrast to the showy floral displays. Audouinia capitata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
